BR_text.BRsummary: association and deauthentication frames are sent to open access points too
BR_text.BRdescription:
Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.
 There are a few networks that are never worth trying to pwn, like open hotspots with login walls, or user-based enterprise networks - right now, pwnagotchi will still spend valuable time associating with these networks and collecting handshakes.
 Describe the solution you'd like
 
 Don't associate with open networks
 Ignore handshakes from EAP / enterprise networks
 
 Describe alternatives you've considered
 
 Ship a default whitelist of networks i.e.
 
 eduroam - user based auth (EAP)
 Telekom_FON - open hotspot with login wall
 ...
 
 
 
 Additional context
 I'm not sure if it makes sense to collect handshakes from enterprise networks, as those are usually certificate based, user+pass, or use different means of login a la EAP

comments_0.comment_text: Yep, noticed this as well with the Vodafone Homespot and Telekom ones in Germany. They are "open", but it spends time on them. Maybe a filtering mechanism...

comments_1.comment_text: this is a bug bettercap's side, it shouldn't happen ... you guys sure those are open aps?

comments_2.comment_text: Yep, I'm seeing mine try associate to "Vodafone Homespot" and "Telekom FON" AP's quite a lot, which are "Open" (but have a captive portal). I'll try spin up an open AP to test with also and see if it tries associate with that.

comments_3.comment_text: i'm an idiot and i should filter out open networks here <denchmark-link:https://github.com/evilsocket/pwnagotchi/blob/master/pwnagotchi/agent.py#L173>https://github.com/evilsocket/pwnagotchi/blob/master/pwnagotchi/agent.py#L173</denchmark-link>

comments_5.comment_text: what's your opinion on the second half of this issue RE: networks like eduroam which use user:pass auth or certificates, can these be filtered too or is there not enough information available at this stage to be able to filter these automatically?
